comment.author: 13935339@N05
comment._content: The ground crew assigned to CAPT J.T. Robbins' first "Jandina" (probably P-38J serial 42-67590) of the 80th Fighter Squadron "Headhunters," 8th FG.

comment.author: 53866720@N06
comment._content: Only Robbin's third and fourth aircraft were named "Jandina," for "Jay" And Ina.  Ina being the Australian Nurse who became his wife.  This was his second P-38, and had the name "Betty" on the left nacelle.  Betty and Ina, both Nurses, didn't like each other much.  By the way, Robbins pronounced Jandina as if in Spanish, ie "Juandina."  This info comes from Jay Robbins son, Lt Col Robbie Robbins, a fellow F-16 driver and fellow former 80th FS member.
